rtega_mnemonic:
謡謡RS謠sing, folksong, ballad, rumor, noh chanting
  • speak 言 from behind an earthenware 䍃 mask
heisig_constituent: noh chanting, say, words, keitai, mouth, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain
koohiiStory1: Noh chanting?!? I meant "NO CHANTING!" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don´t you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting.
koohiiStory2: Picture guy dressed in a condor mask up on stage during Noh performance chanting some words nobody understands.
jp_example_words:
歌謡(かよう): song, ballad
民謡(みんよう): folk song, popular song
jp_readingExamples: 謡う (うた.う), 謡 (うたい)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Whatever you say through a satellite turns into Noh chanting. It gets all drawn out and distorted from going through the satellite, which makes it SOUND like Noh chanting at least.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Say whatever you want and send it up to the satellite. Now imagine listening to it when it comes back and hearing beautiful, deep Noh chanting back!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: While you're fake Noh chanting you have to pause every few minutes to take a bite of yogurt (よう). Yogurt is good for the throat! At least you think it is. It's not like you're actually chanting, the satellite is doing all the real work.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Watch closely the next time you go to a Noh play. See the man Noh chanting? Watch close enough and you'll see him eat a scoop of yogurt every once in a while.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 遥 (はるか、ヨウ далеко), 揺 (ゆれる、ヨウ трястись), 瑶 (たま、ヨウ прекрасный как жемчужина).
Ru_Radicals: 凵 (открытая коробка), 干 (сухой), 爪 (ноготь), 言 (слово)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the words (言) you claw (⺤) from the can (缶) are a Noh play

謡字的基本解释

謡
yáo
见“谣”。

謡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yáo］
［《廣韻》餘昭切，平宵，定。］
“谣1”的繁体字。“謠1”的新字形。
(1)歌唱而不用乐器伴奏。
(2)民间流行的歌谣。
(3)没有根据地传言；凭空捏造的话。

謡字的康熙字典解释

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
謡字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yáo］
["Guangyun" Yu Zhaoqie, flat night, fixed. ]
The traditional characters of "Yao 1". The new glyph of "Yao 1".
(1) Sing without musical accompaniment.
(2) Popular folk songs.
(3) Rumors without grounds; words fabricated out of thin air.

謡
Name meaning
Nothing.
yáo
яп. вм. 谣
Radicals: 言,  (say, satellite)
Meaning Mnemonic
Whatever you say through a satellite turns into Noh chanting. It gets all drawn out and distorted from going through the satellite, which makes it SOUND like Noh chanting at least.
Say whatever you want and send it up to the satellite. Now imagine listening to it when it comes back and hearing beautiful, deep Noh chanting back!
Reading Mnemonic
While you're fake Noh chanting you have to pause every few minutes to take a bite of yogurt (よう). Yogurt is good for the throat! At least you think it is. It's not like you're actually chanting, the satellite is doing all the real work.
Watch closely the next time you go to a Noh play. See the man Noh chanting? Watch close enough and you'll see him eat a scoop of yogurt every once in a while.
